name: Struts1: Only Struts HTTP Servlet should be used for Struts based application
description: For Struts based application, this rule reports all Servlet that inherit from javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet but not from org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet class.
output:
This report lists all HTTP Servlets that don't inherit from Struts action Servlet.
It provides the following information:
  Servlet Full Name, Servlet Class Name
rationale: When Struts framework is used, it must be used for every page in the application to avoid mixing different technologies and creating an application difficult to maintain and be the source of a lack of robustness.
remediation:
Adapt the struts application to use front controller servlet (which is Action Servlet) for all HTTP requests as following one: 
The remediation can be :
<servlet>
    <servlet-name>action</servlet-name>
    <servlet-class>
      org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet
    </servlet-class>
    <init-param>
      <param-name>config</param-name>
      <param-value>/WEB-INF/conf/struts-config.xml</param-value>
    </init-param>
  <servlet>
sample:
---> web.xml

<!-- Struts Action Servlet -->
  <servlet>
    <servlet-name>action</servlet-name>
    <servlet-class>
      org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet
    </servlet-class>
    <init-param>
      <param-name>config</param-name>
      <param-value>/WEB-INF/conf/struts-config.xml</param-value>
    </init-param>
  <servlet>

  <servlet>
    <servlet-name>AnotherServlet</servlet-name>
    <servlet-class>
      // doesn't inherit from org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet
      // but inherits from javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
      com.cast.AnotherServlet // VIOLATION:    
   </servlet-class>
  </servlet>
total: Number of Servlets that inherit from javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet when org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet is used
alternativeName: Ensure to use only Struts HTTP Servlet for Struts based application to avoid mixing different technologies
